title: How many dislikes can we get in one question on Chegg? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is the same question like “how many compliments/comments will i get for the dish i cooked”. Students like or dislike your question based on the quality of answer and the explanation you have given. if it’s a good answer, then the student(who posted the question) will like it and if you provided a bad explanation with probably wrong answer, then the student (who posted the question) will dislike it. You will get more likes/dislikes for the same answer only when some other student who had a similar question or somewhat similar query found your answer. If they find it as good answer with good explanation then they will like it and if not, then they will dislike it. There’s no such “upper cap” for the number of Likes/Dislikes for an answer. it strictly depends on “how many students had the similar query or difficulty on similar concept”. Literally, you may get as few as “single like/dislike” to the “40–50 Likes/dislikes” for the same answer (practically, i have received 35 likes as maximum for one answer in my 2 years of work so far). there is no such limit. this is somewhat similar to “you will get as many comment/compliment from people as many have tasted your cooked dish”.
There is no limit to likes or dislikes to your answer. It depends on the number of views your answer is getting. If your answer is getting multiple dislikes and Chegg team often deletes that answer.
